title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributing to CLPFUDatabase
text: Fork package clone onto computer. Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(). Follow prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e., beneath “always resolves latest release.”).

title: Easily Install and Load Packages to Construct the CL-PFU Database
text: Historically, societal exergy analysis (SEA) practitioners analyzed energy conversion chains (ECCs) individual countries using linked spreadsheets, often starting primary- final-stage data International Energy Agency’s (IEA’s) extended world energy balances (EWEBs) (Ayres, Ayres, Warr 2003; Serrenho et al. 2014; Brockway et al. 2014, 2015). Data stored varying inconsistent formats. early SEA database (De Stercke 2014) estimated energy efficiencies end-use machines using economic status countries, thereby precluding use energy-economy studies. Researchers field wanted expand SEA cover countries, spreadsheet approach SEA deemed scalable. new approach SEA needed, one scaled across countries many years without relying economic data estimate machine efficiencies. address need, created suite R packages support creation use CL-PFU database. creating CL-PFU database involves several R packages much input data. way streamline installation packages needed, single install.packages() call ensure dependencies available. package (CLPFUDatabase) addresses need simple way install dependencies. CLPFUDatabase metapackage1, whose dependencies include packages required make CL-PFU database. Installation CLPFUDatabase triggers installation dependencies CL-PFU database.

title: CLPFUDatabase 0.1.6 (2023-12-21)
text: Fixed typo README.md file. CLPFUDatbase –> CLPFUDatabase

title: CLPFUDatabase 0.1.5 (2023-12-21)
text: Now skipping installation test CI platforms. GITHUB_PAT available CI platforms. Without GITHUB_PAT set .Renviron, installation fails due exceeding GitHub API limits. Now package passes GitHub actions, badge works!
